text: Hands down the best thai food in the Bridgeport/South Loop area. My go to when I need a quick Thai Fix.  The food - I always get the tiger cry as an appetizer, you can't go wrong with. Basil chicken fried rice is a staple when I eat Thai food. Opart Thai house has different levels of spiciness and it really is spicy so order accordingly. I've also tried their Seafood Tom Yum Soup and Seafood Curry. Hands down the best Tom Yum Soup I've ever had and the Seafood curry was not too far behind.  The interior/ambiance - Huge interior, lots of visuals and artwork all around, well lit, spaced out, plenty of seating.  The service - Well experienced servers they have the whole menu memorized, quick with the refills and bill.  Pricing - Very reasonable pricing $$  Parking - There is meter parking on state street BUT! they do share a FREE parking lot in the back with all the other establishments in the area.  Overall - Highly recommended I'll be back to try out the different items on their menu.

I really like Thai food and Opart is in my neighborhood, so I've eaten here at least 30 times (no joke!). It's a solid spot.  I have dined in maybe five times, and the facilities are nice looking and reasonably clean. I have had good experiences with service as the people who work here are accommodating.   The majority of the time I either carry out or have the food delivered.  I usually get some combination of either pot stickers or egg rolls or pad see eiw chicken or a curry dish.  Overall, it's good.  Sometimes very good and every now and again just okay, but on the whole I am satisfied after my meal.  I wouldn't make a special trip for it, but if you're in the area, it's well worth a visit.

Definitely the best Thai Food I've ever had. Wait staff were all so friendly, and service was quick. I've never had duck at such a fair price, but the meat was so tender! Green curry was also fantastic.
I simply just love them. They are quick to pick up, easy to get delivered. Their pad Thai is very unique, and they haven't disappointed me with their chicken Red Curry yet!
We only had desserts. Sticky rice and mango sticky rice with coconut milk. I liked it a lot, tastes almost exactly like the ones I tried in Thailand. Service was courteous and fast.
I order their basil chicken every time and it's always good.  Good stand in for my Siam House out near Skokie.

Awesome thai food. Can't go wrong with any dish. Made a wrong choice by saying we want spicy food. Oh the food was tasty but it was spicy. Medium hot should be preferred. Never knew thai peppers can be so tasty and hot.
I had the Pad Phen and Tom Yum soup. The dishes were served spicy and fast. The ambiance was casual and the wait staff was extremely professional. Nice spot to bring a date.
Clean and comfortable with affordable and edible entrees. Excellent Thai food in a well lit and well managed restaurant. Service and food too notch.
Solid Thai food for great price. I like the pad khee mao a lot. Service is always friendly / good as well.

Excellent and authentic Thai restaurant near Chinatown with off street parking.  Excellent Thai selections in a quaint and well appointed restaurant. The Tiger Cry beef appetizer is worth the trip alone.  The traditional pad thai and curries are all expertly prepared and the portions are reasonable.

Not bad not bad. Stopped by this one a few nights ago with the boo thang for dinner. Overall prices are reasonable (less than $10 per dish), this spot is SpringRewards affiliated, and easy street parking at $2 per hour.  We had the... ~Pad See-lew~ Stir-fried flat rice noodles and Chinese broccoli with egg and sweet soy sauce with choice of chicken, pork, beef, tofu or *shrimp. Oh course with beef... it's what's for dinner. A bit underwhelming to be honest and definitely not as good as some other Thai spots we've been to in the city. ~Pad Ped Pla Dook~Fried catfish sauteed with red curry paste, Thai eggplant and green beans. The flavors and spicy on this dish were excellent and it even included a side of rice in the listed price. Bravo. Only downside was I thought the portion was a bit skimpy.  Anyways, overall a solid spot and very affordable if you cash in on those SpringRewards... let's just say that I paid more for parking than I did to eat here. 'Til next time, cheers! 177/365

I can definitely see the appeal of this place. Easy parking on the street (FYI $2/hour), a spring rewards company, quick service, and plenty of seating. The prices are decent: $8-10 for an entree, and the food is good. The portions are not huge, though so prepared for no leftovers. We ordered a pad see ew with beef and a curry catfish dish. I like that unlike a lot of thai places, this place gives rice included. The pad see ew was decent, as was the curry dish. My only complaint was that I think I saw three pieces of catfish? I left a little hungry but still satisfied..
Loved it. Really good neighborhood restaurant. Everything was delicious. Service was a bit abrupt but also friendly. I'll go back next time I'm in Chicago.
Chicken satay a ok Pot sickers great and huge Pad see eiw beef was Lacking something flavor wise That order lasted 2 meals. This was a delivery.  I would try again
A Chicago must. Great food and service. What more could you ask for in a restaurant. Friendly service too! Just go...

Opart Thai House is mine and my family's favorite Thai restaurant in Chicago. They always have enough space to seat us when we dine out in a big group (I have a big family so usually a party of 15+). The food is always, always, ALWAYS amazing. And the prices are reasonable.  The decor is beautiful with golden jeweled head pieces and colorful artwork on display. The restaurant is always clean and the wait is never long.  Although you won't find the waitresses chatting you up or smiling too much for that matter, but they always get the job done.  We've been loyal Opart customers for many, many years, before this location even opened (Western location was the original) so we've tried our fair share of dishes. Everything on the menu is delicious! Seriously though!  BUTTTTT if you're struggling on deciding what to order, some of my favorites are:  *TIGER CRY...ITS AMAZING! (We always SHAMELESSLY order more than one. Ha!) *Shu-Mai *Poh Tak (seafood soup) *Khao Soy *Pad Thai *Seafood Combination Fried Rice *Any of the curries *Thai Iced Coffee  Opart Thai House never disappoints with their consistently delicious food! Maybe one day they'll open a location even further south so I can indulge a little more often ;)

Pretty good Thai place. I'm not sure how it compares to other places because it's the only Thai place around where I live so I can't really say it's the best.  I got the crab Rangoon, pad Thai with tofu, and mango sticky rice.  First off, there's no way you can screw up crab Rangoon. It's fried and just amazing. It's a safe appetizer that everyone will like.  The pad Thai was a little sweet so I'd recommend getting it a little spicy. (The medium spicy is barely spicy. I'd consider it white people spicy tbh). And just fyi, the protein you get is gonna be on the bland side just because of how flavorful the noodles are.  The mango sticky rice was awesome. It was a great way to end the meal. But if I'm gonna be honest, I don't think I've had bad mango sticky rice anywhere anyways.  Go here if you're craving Thai. Overall a good place to get your fix.

This was our first Chicago Thai experience. We were great fans of Rod Dee 2 in Boston and this place made me realize that Thai food comes in non-tofu dish shapes and sizes. We began our meal with the Tiger Cry. This dish is highly recommended by Yelpers and I would truly demand a larger serving if I wasn't terrified of the ever-so-slightly mean waitresses. The dish comes with olive oil and lemon sauce with Thai spices on the side and the beef is garnished with cilantro in a way that makes me, a Mediterranean person, accept the superiority of cilantro to parsley.  Our main courses were Catfish Curry and Duck Curry. I'll update the names of these when we go back again. My husband likes his southern cooking so he enjoyed the catfish more than someone like me did. This was my first time tasting duck. It feels like eating turkey only you're kind of upset that a cuter animal has been killed for you --we'll get back to my emotions later. We'll be coming back to try new dishes, it is a really clean and comfortable restaurant with nice warm Thai tea for this May 2017 that seems to forget its supposed to be a bit warmer.

I am so glad I discovered this spot. A friend to me there for an early birthday dinner and boy am I glad I discovered the spot.  The location was great and walking distance to Chinatown which is nice if you enjoy walking. The only downside to this is that there is no parking in the area and you'll have to pay to park. I'll def recommend getting on the CTA.  We started off with the Neau Num Tok and the Tom Yum Soup. The Neau Num Tok was absolutely amazing.... I don't remember if we requested it extra spicy but it had some raw onions in there and it was to die for. My girlfriend didn't like the taste of raw onions and she preferred the Tiger Cry which I found very bland and much on the sweet side. The Tom Yum soup was very nice too ... more on the sour side, I didn't like the imitation crab that was in it but everything else was great. We also shared a plate of their shrimp pad thai and it was delicious as well and a bit on the sweet side.  Finally we ordered some Mai Tai's and they were great. They has limited options to choose from when it comes to cocktails in my opinion.  Overall, the experience was great and I will def be returning.

The dishes are really fresh and clean. I love spicy food and they sure know how to make it spicy! Friendly service. I also like golden Thai, but this place may actually be better, although more pricy for the amount of food you get.

I have been going to Opart Thai House for over 30 years. They have the most authentic, best Thai food in Chicago HANDS DOWN. Having actually been to Thailand twice, I have some experience with the real thing.

Great dishes and great prices! I had the fresh squid in red chile sauce, spicy. It wasn't overly spicy, but so flavorful I didn't care. My husband had the cashews and chicken with peanut sauce and this too was tasty and fabulous. Highly recommend

That 1 star is for a very rude waitress who yelled at me, and you know who you are.  I had a few questions regarding the menu, and asked politely to this female staff who was taking my order.  but she was very rude. She didn't want to answer my questions, totally gave me that look, and when I asked her again, she raised her voice on me.  Will not go here again. no thanks.

Opart was fantastic. There were 6 of us in our party for lunch and we all really enjoyed everything. The papaya salad was fresh (and comes with some heat). The green and red curry were also incredibly tasty; just creamy enough and just spicy enough to pair well with tofu.
Nice little Thai place. We got in before the dinner crowd filled the place. Very noisy when full. Food was delish, and service good. It would be a regular stop for us if we lived in Chicago.

I ordered take out. I tried the pad see ew with tofu and it was so good! The wait wasn't too long and the man who took our order was absolutely adorable and so funny! The restaurant was nicely decorated and had a lot of seating. I'll definitely dine in next time!

Ordered Pad Thai and the chicken and noodles were so dry. I called back bc it appeared it was made without sauce and the person on the phone argued with me and said next time I should order extra sauce. "Ummmm how about you try making my order correctly."
Place wasn't​ crowded and still had poor service. I had  to wave to the waitress twice for service. Pad Thai was wet, mushy consistency

I think I had a bad experience here a few years ago that kind of made me wary to give Opart Thai another try. However, the bf was interested so we headed here at 5 pm on a Friday night and there were only a few tables occupied, so we got seated right away. We got crab Rangoon, which where delicious and generously portioned (8 pieces for $6 and change). Then, I had red curry duck ($9.99) and my companion had the pad Thai ($8). The portions were generous and the flavors were pretty tasty. I liked the pad Thai more than my entree, which was a bit too sweet (probably the pineapples). The red duck curry had sliced boneless pieces of duck with skin, pineapples, and tomato. Will come back to try more food Update: I came here again five days after my initial review and I would have to downgrade it to 3.5 stars because we got the tiger cry appetizer and it wasn't charred on the outside like it's supposed to be, and the meat was very tough. Tiger cry is supposed to have charred outside and a rare center. Also, I got the basil pork and while the flavor was good, it was extremely Salty.
I order pick up orders from here all the time. Food is good and it's always ready when i get there.  My favorite Go-to in the South loop. I get the Pad Thai with chicken and egg rolls.

I was having a very fat moment and stopped here for chicken pad thai and Shu mai, then went next door to the Burger Point for my fiance'. The food was great. Nice size portion, friendly staff. I will definitely be back.

Ordered $150 worth of food. The driver got lost, the food was not labeled, there was no flavor to the food, it was basically inedible! If you do not know where McCormick Lakeside Gate 37 is then don't accept a delivery!

My go to spot to order Thai take-out in the south loop. Love the Khao Soy.. egg noodles with curry and chicken. Definitely order the Tiger Cry for an appetizer its charbroiled tender beef & it comes with this delicious vinegary dipping sauce. The Pad See Eew is really good too, I like ordering with beef. Also, can never go wrong with Pad Thai. It's a smaller portion compared to other take-out spots, but it is tasty! Basically I'm a fan of all their staple noodle dishes.  I've never actually eaten inside the restaurant, we always do delivery or carry-out but either way I would for sure reccommend Opart if you're in the mood for some delicious Thai food.

My favorite Thai place in the city! I love their curries and chicken satay. I've tried many different things on the menu and they've all been delicious. Great place for lunch or take out for dinner. Yum!

Worth the walk from McCormick but too rainy and wet today, should've Uber'd.     Judging by the large number of people here on a Sunday afternoon, about two dozen, and a local, I stopped on the street, this place is obviously a great and local staple.   As usual I had the red curry and it was phenomenal. Based on other things seen, you can't go wrong.  I had the 4th spicy out of five, but it must be an American scale, not Thai. If you like spicy go for five.   Very efficient staff. Clean and nice ambience.  My server said it is always busy.    I can't wait to get back again and try a different dish.

This place is a great gem of the neighborhood and if you like Thai food I believe that you would really like this place. It is a nice quaint restaurant and the service was great even with the language barrier that was between the waitress and myself. I have been here several times and the last time was for my birthday when a few of us got together and ordered just about everything on the menu...ok a slight exaggeration but our table was full and so was our bellies...lol  I will say if you eat beef then you can't leave without tasting the Tiger Cry it will make you do a happy dance right there at the table as the flavors explode on your tongue awakening your taste buds with every bite.  We had to order two more after everyone had a little taste of this beefalious treat.  I can't forget the sauce that comes with the Tiger Cry it was so good I was still eating when the beef was gone...lol We also had the Chicken Satay, Fried Shrimp Spring Rolls, Shu-Mai, Shrimp Tempura and the Crab Rangoon and it was all exceptional and fresh! I had the Tom Yum Koong(Shrimp) with a medium spice I don't know if I was a punk because I couldn't handle medium spice and when I told the waitress she brought me back a mild spice soup but it was not as flavorful as the medium spice one but it was still good all the same.  With all the appetizer we ordered I didn't order an Entrée but now I wish I did so I could have taken it home for leftovers.  Everyone's food looked so good and they all said that the food was very tasty...I will remember that the next time I go with a large group of friends. My daughter ordered Pad Paak Roum Mit I believe but don't quote me because sometimes all of the dishes sound the same in my head but anyway this is what happened...lol  After ordering the waitress asked my daughter how spicy did she want her meal and she said "HOT!" The waitress repeated "HOT!" with confidence my daughter said "Yesss! I love HOT!" The waitress in her own way was giving my daughter a warning "You sure HOT!" she just smiled and shook head and the waitress walked away and said ok...In her mind I know she had to be thinking "Its your funeral!"  When the Entrée came to the table it smelled and looked so good but at first bite I think my daughter's eyebrows seared off her face...lol Her eyes started watering and then she picked up her glass of water to help with the heat and all that did was intensify the heat, that was the best laugh of the night.  My daughter was different than me she was determined to eat her meal but she did it very slowly...lol One of my friends had the Pad Lard Nar and she said it was simply delicious she got it at medium spice and loved it! I'm not going to get into what everyone had for one I would have to write a book not a review and two I can't remember everyone's Entrée from that night, but I can say there wasn't one complaint just nods of happiness. They also have BYOB which is cool and they don't have a cork fee that's always doubly nice. The wait staff was amazing and we didn't feel rushed we just sat there enjoying each others company, great food and wine. One more thing the parking can get critical on a Sunday when there is a game because there aren't to many places to park so make sure you read the signs because there were a lot of people with tickets on their cars.  Now this isn't the restaurants fault and I think that its a stupid rule because some people left because they drove around for a half an hour to find a park and couldn't find one that didn't have the No Parking Sign up during a certain event.  That to me hurts not only the business but the customer who has to walk a half a mile just to get to the restaurant.  I most definitely recommend this place so if you are in the neighborhood or if you are making plans don't forget Opart Thai Restaurant, in my opinion you won't regret it! I know I will be back! Enjoy!!!!

The food is full of flavor and the soup is EXCELLENT.  We ate there two days straight and ate our leftovers for lunch the next day.  The prices are reasonable too.  We will eat here again next year when we're in town again.  When you have a choice between seafood or meat, choose the seafood because it tastes better.

Delicious as usual and even with the price increase since I've last visited, it's still a great value. Curries are amazing, as are all the noodle dishes including pad Thai and pad see ewe, and the Tom yum is delish. You pretty much can't go wrong with anything you order.

Good, clean atmosphere. Full bar. Seated immediately but then waited 15 minutes for server. Ordered: Miang Sa-Wan as appetizer-- too much ginger; Tom Yum Kai--lukewarm and too much lime; Peanut lovers--too sweet, not spicy enough; Gaeng Daeng--very good, still not spicy enough.
Update: The rude delivery guy was not a fluke, a couple of their delivery people are pretty rude all the time! ...but we still tolerate it because the food is still my favorite.
We used to live above this place.  The dishes are fresh and well flavored- we always got the pad thai, peanut lover's chicken, and dumplings are really good.  The martinis are pretty yummy as well!

This was for delivery: Ordered Spicy Beef (comes on a skewer) -- overcooked, tough Teriyaki chicken (okay not an inspired choice) -- overcooked, tough, and no sauce? Larb Gai - good Pot Stickers - okay Disappointed with my ~$50 purchase

They have great food. However people who work there can be rude. Very disrespectful and filled with sass. They also lie about closing up the place early so they don't have to serve their customers. I'd step it up a notch on service because that's usually a key item for many.

Standard good neighborhood Thai place, nothing to write home about. We dropped in early Saturday night and had no difficulty getting a table. Service was quite fast, although sometimes getting questions answered can be exciting (none of the staff appeared to speak particularly much English). I went with the peanut lover's sauce with chicken, extra spicy. The meat was well cooked and the peanut sauce was quite good, but there was no spice. At all. Genuinely no heat. This was ordered from the spicy food section and ordered at their hottest setting! I wound up asking our waitress for extra chili paste so I could get any heat at all. I wouldn't mind going back or grabbing takeout if I was in the area, not sure I'd go back if it requires a substantial trek.

The food was pretty good- we got moo ping (super tender and flavorful), Penang curry (huge portion that 1 bowl of rice wasn't even enough), and tom yum (came in like a cute kettle with flame). Food didn't take long to come out. Excellent customer service! Me and my friend came in at 7 and didn't leave til 10 because we were catching up! The staffs didn't even try to rush us out even though they were already mopping the floor. Love this place!

I was in the area a few days ago and decided to give this place a try. I enjoyed the food, nothing special but good enough to not disappoint. Give them a try. I had a sampler and a type of curry. For the price I'd expect better portions and flavor.

One of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. Asides from this location, there are two more. However, my friends and I always come back to this location due to the friendly staffs. We always end up ordering the same dishes. The Crab Rangoons is a must for appetizer (creamy on the inside and crunchy texture on the outside, hmm).  As for the main dishes, the red curry, the Tiger Cry, Tom Yum soup and the Pad Thai.  The Tiger Cry is OMG out of this world, the balance of spiciness, saltiness and sourness are on point. As for the Tom Yum soup, I would recommend getting the fish instead of the shrimp. They tend to be more generous with the fish. I remembered getting 4-5 shrimps with my order of soup (so not worth). The Red curry is amazing, creamy texture with the perfect amount of heat. As for the Pad Thai, it's aight (can be a hit or a miss, depending on the day). As for the drinks, the Thai Tea is a must. However, they also serve alcoholic drinks too. Free parking, however, limited space depending on the day.

Okay, this is a little weird to write because I'm not quite sure how to specifically name this ingredient that causes my discomfort at some Thai restaurants (but very few - maybe one other place that this has happened...?) The restaurant smells like a mixture of wet dog and urine. Like I said, this has happened to me maybe one other time at another Thai restaurant. I'm guessing it's some ingredient that has a heavy, unpleasant odor when it goes bad...? Again, I'm not sure.  HOWEVER, my boyfriend and I stopped here for an early dinner on a Saturday. It was around 4pm and there were a few tables taken, so it was obviously a popular place. The smell bothered both of us, but we were starving so we stayed. I'M GLAD WE DID. We ordered the Tiger Cry, Pad Thai and Broccoli Lover's with chicken.  The Tiger Cry was AMAZING and we'll probably return just because of that. It was smoked(?) with a lovely flavor and perfectly tender. They should definitely expand a smaller menu with this as the focal point! So yummy!! The Pad Thai was pretty typical but I'm always pleased to find a place that does it well since I can't say amazing thai food is easy to come by in Chicago for some reason. I'm always excited to go to New York to get some incredible Thai food. The Broccoli Lover's with chicken seemed to skimp out on the broccoli, believe it or not. Very basic and good for someone watching their diet closely.  So, go if you can get over the smell. If you can't, definitely order delivery because I still really enjoyed the food!

My new favorite Thai place!  Safe to say that I am a Thai snob.  I've tried many places in Chicago...and most of them fall short.  Opart Thai is amazing.  You know it's a good place when all the cops and firefighters go there to eat.  Pad Thai and curries are amazing. Great: Tiger Cry (appetizer) Crab Rangoon (appetizer) Pad Thai All Thai Curries (especially Gaeng Panang) Not great: Pad Prik King

Omg I am in food coma with this amazing chicken salad!! I am so happy I asked the person who took my order for a no carb suggestion and he recommended this dish. It's nice and spice with a bit of a tang to it . I am a happy camper tonight !!!

Haven't ordered from here in awhile, and now, I recall the reasons why...my orders are never consistent w flavors, which changes everytime. The panang curry and basil chicken...I would much rather wait for Asian Outpost to open to get much better flavors, cheaper prices and more food.

I just got two things from here so maybe I just didn't get the best things.  I got the shrimp Tom yum soup and the Khao Soi noodles with chicken. The Tom yum soup had way too much lemongrass and fish sauce. It was just tart on top of tart.  Other Tom yum soups I have had typically have a sweet note to it.  The khao soi noodles were better but I ordered it hot and it was not spicy at all.  Otherwise flavoring was good.  Not sure if I would come back.
Consistently delicious Thai food! My go to place for pick me up home food! The Tiger Cry, Peanut lover's sauce and Khao Soy dishes are to die for!
When I move from Chicago, I will literally come to town to eat the Tiger Cry. Don't hesitate, it's the Chicago Tai Spot.

Was staying at the Hyatt McCormick for a conference, wanted to look for a place nearby that wasn't pricey and found this. Ordered some Thai noodle dish, was pretty decent with decent sized portions, all for just $8. Only complaint was the noodles were soft from overcooking. It's pretty common; most places I go to overcook noodles to a softness instead of a nice chewy al dente temperature. Still, noodle dish was satisfying and did the trick, especially considering the price. The place also has a decent selection of wine and beer. On a side note, I walked to the place on a Monday night at around 8, and the streets were deserted and kind of sketchy. Had to walk under the elevated subway and some unpaved sketchy lots, but once I got to the place it was fine, as it was in some nice block, and there were a lot of patrons inside.

I used to live in the north side of Chicago and Opart Thai House on Western was my favorite restaurant. I was so happy when they opened another one in the south loop where I live now. The food is wonderful and the tiger cry beef is my favorite thing ever. I'd recommend this place if you were looking for a authentic Thai restaurant in the south loop area. The service is great and they're pretty quick with online orders too. I'll definitely be coming back a lot.

I had Pad Prik Lard Khao and Prad Kra Praow Lard Khao delivered and both were very disappointing. The little gravy they put on each had been absorbed by the rice by the time they were delivered. We were forced to try to eat incredibly dry dishes. I can't understand why they don't deliver the entree and the rice separately. When I called, a worker said they would've come separately had I ordered a larger serving but they don't choose to tell you that over the phone. It was very disappointing because I threw $25 down the drain.

Love their food! Delivery can sometimes be slow because they are so busy. But everytime I do my own pickup they are super friendly and food is made fast! This is my go-to thai place since I live in the west loop.

Definitely one of the better Thai places in Chicago. The noodles, basil chicken, and moo ping are fantastic! It would be 4/5 star if they didn't nickel and dime you on substituting sauces. Why would you charge an additional $1 for peanut sauce with moo ping when all you want to do is replace the peanut sauce with the sauce that comes with the moo ping. The sauce that comes with the moo ping is disgusting.

Great Thai in the Loop that any fan of Thai should try.   Went here with a friend for dinner about a week ago, and was not disappointed in what we had. Got there about 6:30 on a Wednesday night and the place was packed!! Place is small, dimly lit, and very pleasant to enjoy an evening after work.   Sat down and a waitress quickly took our order.  Each got a main dish that was good, plentiful, and came out boiling hot.  The only complaint, was the flavor wasn't that great. Seemed to be a bit weak, but otherwise it was great.   Great service, good food, great atmosphere, and great prices for the South Loop.  Would definately recommend checking it out and dropping by for a try. Also, the menu selection is great and has something for everyone and every pallet. From mild to spicy, they have great options and ask (which is nice) the level of spice you want).

The customer service was great but i dont like to be stared at while im eating. The appetizer sampler platter was delicious. I ordered #62 which is cooked vegetables chopped thickly, with a choice of meat in a pool of watery sweet and sour sauce. I would not recommend this meal. Another meal i would not recommend  is #39. The vegetables were undercooked , cold, and tasted like they came out of a can. Both were flavorless.

We definitely recommend the duck curry and the tiger cry. So so yummy. We ordered larb - a salad with lettuce and minced pork. The dish was 9 bucks but there was very little lettuce. We asked for more but were informed that they would charge an addition of 2 bucks. If it didnt happen i would have rated 5 stars. The portion is pretty small but they give quite a lot of rice.
Great Thai place on the South side.  I'll never say no to Opart Thai.

Chicken satay is really good and I come here when I want a nice peanut sauce fix. The pad Thai is a little too sweet. It's good the first couple bites and then I have to wrap the box to go. The pad see ew is solid. The curry fried rice is tasty. The fried shrimp appetizer is ok. We come here as our go to Thai restaurant. Good location and has parking.
The tiger cry is off the chain. You must order it.  If you don't, you will be cheating yourself.  Don't be that person.  Loved it

Just ok. I don't get the hype. This is my second time coming here and I'm still not impressed. I got the tiger cry which was tasty but my meat pieces were cut too small. Crab rangoon was tasty, crispy, and the sauce was good but no crab, just cream cheese. Then the panang beef. SOOO WATERY with about 6 or seven beef pieces; terrible. I'm done. Service was good and friendly. I need suggestions for a great thai restaurant.

My wife had suggested we try this place to break up our usual norms for delivery and on the two separate times I've had it one was excellent, and one was alright. The one that was excellent featured the Tiger Cry beef. It was savory and spicy. Perfectly seasoned, and something I recommend to any meat lover. The second time we ordered I tried a curry and while it wasn't bad, it just wasn't for me. It was a well prepared dish with interesting flavors but because of the flavor I could only eat a little at a time. This was not something I could devour or something I'd want to reheat as leftovers.  There's not very many great Thai places in the area so this place has low become our first choice!

Rangoons so good, make you pee in the bed. Literally.  Its been a year and a half, and I've only been been there once, but last night I dreamt I was eating the crab rangoons and didnt want to stop to go pee, so in dream world decided to pee where I was in the dining room. But then in real life peed the bed. Haven't done that since I was 6. For that reason, a flight to Chicago is in my near future.

I ordered pad thai and specified "very spicy" in the notes for delivery. It was really bland and had zero spice. When the delivery guy came, he made us go down to pick it up instead of bringing it up. Now I wish I hadn't bothered giving a tip.
Ordered for delivery they add $ 10 delivery charge which does not go to driver we still need to tip the driver  than order is wrong and items are missing. You should stop deliver food
LONG OVERDUE!!!  This place has some of the best thai food there is! Wait time wasn't too bad either and service was impeccable!

Don't go for delivery. We just tried the worst Thai food in town. Most of it went into the garbage bin. Here is the summary. Rice included pieces of an unidentifiable brown mass - and it was definitely not a sauce or burned. Red curry was way off - didn't even smell right - and the eggplant in it was undercooked and tofu was completely flavorless. Tom Yum soup was off again and basically tasted like vinegar. Restaurant refused a refund. As a side note - they tried to convince me that this is the way it is supposed to taste. I lived in Thailand for 3 years! Maybe just a bad night for them.

i usually get the same thing whenever i eat at a thai restaurant -- chicken pad thai, no bean sprouts, medium spicy $8.59. it just wasn't that impressive here. not as much flavor. i prefer the pad thai at golden thai. i will give them points for the larger serving size though. enough for leftovers to eat for lunch the next day.  i also tried the crab rangoons $6.59 for an order of 8. they were decent but i did not taste or see any crab meat in there whatsoever. they just tasted like cream cheese to me.

Been coming here for this past couple years. I thought I wrote a review but nope, I guess I forgot. So, here it is.  I used to dine in here with my husband (before we have kids) and the food is always on point. All I do now is practically do carry out. I work around here so this place is the only place I can satisfy my cravings for Thai food within walking distance. The food is okay. Not bad and nothing special. I used to like their Tom Ka Gai soup, but not anymore. They only put like literally a couple pieces tiny chicken. The only thing that I order now is their pad prik lard khao with tofu. It is okay. Decent one person portion for $10. Every once in awhile, I order their wonton soup. It's a bit on the oily side but then again, I will eat anything at this point just because I don't like to walk to far to go to chinatown. Will add more star if they improve their food quality. Oo and just call in for your order because when I order through the website, it cost more.

Dis place is decent yooooooo. Don't listen to the reviews that sez dey ain't spicy. Tell that to my recently deceased gastrointestinal tract. Lips look like I got injections from dat spicy shizz and I can handle spice. For da fools who say it's not seasoned or flavorful enough, lies. Some stuff be too salty. I got the basil fried rice with ground pork thing and instantaneous dehydration but frfr. I saw someone sez roast duck red curry good but nah son don't do it!!!! Crab Rangoon was moneeeeey, talk bout chyo snap crackle of fried wonton and pop of cream cheese. We got the tiger cry but spicy version, I will be back for dat with a bowl of rice. Deyz hav no mango sticky rice. Service is whatever, but I know what imma be back fo. Holla atchyo gurl.  Update: Went for the third time, service was on point tonight.

Truly amazing is how this restaurant stay busy with one of the worst Thai food experience in the city. Is there no pride left at serving Thai cuisine? We ordered the Chicken basil which appears to be mince chicken stirred in a jar with sugar, lime and coconut juice. I mean it absolutely did not have any pan seared flavor and look and tasted like it came from a can and reheated in the microwave.  Then there's the Pad Thai, which really should be called BAD Thai. The noodles were so slushy and overcooked it literally tasted like noodle soup that's been on stove for over 24 hours. Based on the presentation or the lack there of, the cook (not chef) brew the noodles in a  50 servings pot then whomever ordered their desired meat, they just added into the plate before serving.  Will not be going back as this is a lesson learned and Chinatown is only 5 mins away with much better quality food. Never go to an Asian rest with less than 50℅ Asian patrons.

It was just okay, nothing to rave about and nothing to rant about EXCEPT, the fact that I ordered shrimp in the pad thai, but they put chicken (why??)... The beef in the Tiger Cry had good flavor but was a bit to tough/chewy for me, Egg Rolls were edible, and the rice dish not so much..... I would not order again, perhaps it's better to go there and eat but I'll never know as I will not give them a second chance.  Please note the food did arrive hot and was fresh.
Flavors are good, but my green curry was mostly tofu, with like, 3 green beans and a few pieces of Thai eggplant (which I don't like)?! Feels really skimpy. Blegh.

Really good Thai food, but the service was a bit slow when we came. Granted it was a little busy with lots of phone orders, but we ended up waiting for quite a bit. Tum yum soup was a little cold- when we asked about it they said the burner in the middle of the serving dish was supposed to warm it up- hmmmm pretty sure that's not how it's done but okay. The taste was good though. Pad Thai was good, not the best I've ever had but it wasn't too saucy or sweet. Fried rice was yummy and the pad see ew was delicious. I would probably order again as Take out!  Yummilicious factor = B+
The food was okay, nothing special. I ordered the chicken fried rice with no egg and medium spicy. My date order the veggie fried rice and the crying tiger. Overall good place but not the best

Not bad Thai food I had other Thai food from other restaurant one in little Italy and other on western. This is the number three I like. Would recommend this place to my friend and family. There is parking but not a lot.

Not the best Thai food I've had and they need to step it up on their customer service. Their Pad see iew was over cooked; the noodles were too soft. On another note, their sweet & sour chicken is very delicious. In my experience, their take out food seems to be better than dining in

This is my first time ordering from Opart I don't know if something went wrong in the kitchen tonight, but the food was terrible . Not edible! The tom yam was the only good thing from our order.  The Tigers tear salad was only meat, no lettuce or veggies or dressing.  Noodle dish was overcooked and had no taste or flavor. It was one mass of something !! All mushed together !!! The chicken and garlic was equally tasteless   We didn't know if it was chicken or any out her meat! No garlic or peppers !  All the dinner is sitting untouched !! Terrible !!!

After one visit, this place is solid. Good price...good service...and I can definitely see myself getting takeout from here regularly. Chicken satay was standard but good with peanut sauce. Cucumber salad on side could have had a little more flavor but was still refreshing. Had the infamous tiger cry app with the dipping sauce. Was deliciously tender. Ordered spring rolls and didn't realize they weren't standard spring rolls until they arrived cold with a thick sauce on top. Wasn't a huge fan but it wasn't bad. Just not my thing. For entrees we ordered the Pad Prik King with beef. Beef again was super tender and had nice heat. Order tofu Pad Kra Praow. Had a nice fresh ginger flavor and again was also delicious. Now onto my go to dish...the Panang curry with chicken. Flavor was awesome...sauce thickness was just right...heat was good and not overpowering. Only drawback to this dish was that it had no vegetables in it. Usually it will come with peppers and/or green beans but had neither. Would suggest to add and I would not feel the need to find another place to compare. Overall a solid Thai place I will definitely order from again.

This place used to be a go to for Thai food. However, the quality seems to have gone down and I don't think I'll be coming back. The portions are pretty tiny and dishes contain very little meat. Take out and dine in dishes have left me disappointed.

I was expecting more based on reviews. The decor and ambiance is inviting but I was rather disappointed with the entire experience. My group of 3 and I ordered  an array of dishes and they were mostly watered down and bland. Staff was friendly but we had difficulty trying to communicate. Our dishes did not come out as spicy as requested. We inquired about "boat noodle" which we thought was a common Thai dish, but waitress couldn't understand us.

Best Thai food in Chicago in my opinion. The only place I can compare it to California's Thai restaurants. Love the tiger cry, pad thai, tom yum soup, etc. I even order delivery and it takes them 30 minutes to deliver. Always on time.

I'm a huge fan of Thai food and usually look for it anytime I'm traveling so I was really happy to find a Thai place with delivered when I was stuck at the Hyatt in South Loop. First I was very excited to find Naem Sod on the menu as its rare to find and even rarer to find a place that does it well and Opart does. It was super fresh (delivery was super fast and friendly) with fresh ginger, green and red onions and roasted peanuts. I chose ground chicken and it was on point with exactly the spice level I had order which was medium. The naem sod was seasoned perfectly with just enough heat to numb your lips but still be very tasty. The other dish I ordered was based on Yelp reviews as well as the description and the Tiger Cry did not disappoint. The beef was tender and charbroiled and came with a salty sweet sauce that was a bit on the overly salty side but the perfect complement to the beef. Based on these two dishes I would definetly return to Opart and try more of the menu. I did read a few reviews that stated the portions were small but I didn't find this to be true at all as both dishes were around 8.00 and easily fed two people as appetizers (even though we had them for mains).

Update four months later. Saturday night and we have out of town guests and all including us under the weather. We decide to give Opart another chance because everyone is craving Thai food and can't do much more than delivery. Food is excellent again as it used to be! Hooray. Only three stars tho cause they are on probation/trial period.
Only got delivery but man they are spot on. Food only took about 20 minutes to et here. And it is amazing!!

Had delivery of a lot of different items. Food was excellent and they gave us an extra large portions.  Loved each dish.  Red curry sweet potato chicken coconut was awesome.  Love the pad thai.  Will definitely be ordering from them again.

Best Thai food in all of Chicago. They're Tom Kah Kai soup is absolutely my favorite, and the Tiger Cry is godly!!!! Never long time to wait once you order, and beautiful decorations if you want to eat inside. Will never stop coming here xoxoxox
One of my favorite places for delivery.  Awesome Thai food and very fast and friendly drivers.  Best Thai food in the South Loop hands down.

Would've given it 3 stars because the food is okay (not amazing, but good enough for a quick take out), but OH MY GOODNESS are the portions MEA-GER.  I ordered the paeng gaeng curry (red curry with chicken and bamboo) and pad see-ew. Gave me a small take out box for rice and it wasn't even full. Maybe 80%. When I dumped it out it was a small bowl of rice. Like does it really cost that much to top off the last 20% of the box with plain white rice..? And the pad see-ew was also a very tiny box, the size of my palm and about and inch and a half deep. Not worth $10 per entree. I get giving small portions if the quality of the food was blowing the roof off (it's not), but taste is at best average and the quantity is FAR below to the point where I would consider it stingy. I've eaten in the restaurant before and felt the same also, but was willing to give the place another chance. But after this take out experience, it's a no-go for me. Much better options around for the same price that taste better and you get more food! Sorry Opart Thai, will not be returning.

Nice inside and affordable, but service is terrible. Very unattentiveand not friendly. I had to beg for water and when i asked for chili sauce they acted like i was bothering them. I have been waiting the whole time I wrote this to get my bill.  Food is okay, but I have had much better.

Don't go if you really want to spoil your dinner. Our food took 60 mins to come which was cold. We complain and 2 mins we get the same food back on the table stating that the chef made it fresh. Bad service and bad customer service

The place has a nice vibe--not a casual restaurant but not formal either. I went there because I saw some great reviews. I ordered Pad Thai because how can you go wrong with Pad Thai at a Thai restaurant, right? It was pretty good, but the spice level wasn't as expected. The "hot" spice level was not hot at all. Other than that, I would probably come back if I crave Thai food.
Very reasonable prices Pretty much one of the few decent place to eat in the southern loop :(  should have more choices.. And a bit far walk from the McCormick hotel.

Placed a delivery order at 3:03 and didn't get it until after 4:15 pm. Not a big deal until I start eating what they claim to be Thai food. First off, I ordered a Vietnamese coffee, peanut sauce spring rolls and a chicken pad Thai. Never will be ordering from here again. The coffee was nothing like a normal sweet Vietnamese coffee and tasted like a regular iced coffee. The spring rolls aren't "spring rolls." They're wrapped in some thick pastry wrap and stuffed with just an egg roll, cucumber, tofu and bean sprouts that don't even appear to be edible. Lastly, my Pad Thai that I was looking forward to consuming was so difficult to eat as all the noodles were just stuck together and there was no taste to it. They didn't even give me Sriracha so I'm just using my own to try to disguise the tasteless meal. Chicken was overcooked and it's just noodles and chicken and nothing green.  I was expecting no gourmet meal but I was expecting food that I could eat. Don't advertise yourselves as a Thai restaurant when you can't even cook Thai food.

Great decor inside, friendly services, and very delicious menu items! Have been here on multiple occasions and have also ordered carry out from here as well and they have never failed me whenever I have cravings for Thai food and flavors! Some of my favorites are the Khao Soy with chicken, the papaya salad, and their seasonal Mango with Thai Sticky Rice.  The Khao Soy is a creamy coconut curry dish with thin egg noodles and topped with crispy fried egg noodles. This combination is heavenly dangerous! The curry is seriously bowl licking good! The papaya salad compliments the curry well with the refreshing fish sauce based sauce and crunchy shredded green papaya, carrots, string beans, and tomatoes. The addition of the pessimist is what really makes this salad so dynamic and great. The nutty, sweet, and slightly sour flavors make me go back for more.  The Mango and Thai Sticky Rice is seasonal so I always feel extremely lucky whenever they let me know that they do have it that day! The mangoes they use are always sweet and ripe from my experiences! The rice is also nicely sweetened with the coconut milk and sprinkled with sesame seeds. The combination of the sweet with nutty flavors as well with the sticky and chewy textures are to die for!

Ordered take out via GrubHub , highly recommended. These guys are spot on with the order details. I wanted it extra spicy and they gave me extra spicy -- not like a lot of these places who say it's spicy but all you'll get is a tickle even if you ask for the heat. The flavor is authentic and fresh. Food was delivered 30 minutes after I ordered, when I was quoted 1hr-1.25hrs for delivery and was definitely still hot! They also properly packaged the food which I truly appreciate so I wasn't greeted by a soupy, wet mess that one has been accustomed to when it comes to deliveries. I think the price is really fair, only spent a little over $40 for 2 orders of panang curry (which come with rice), tom yum shrimp and a thai iced tea--the cost included tips and the $3 delivery fee and we have plenty of left over for 2 people. I'll definitely find my way to their physical location soon

I went to Opart Thai House with my girlfriend as a stop on a cross country road trip; we got the chicken green curry, pad Thai, and mango with sticky rice dessert.  The green curry was out of this world amazing - I'm fairly obsessed with Thai food and have traveled extensively throughout Thailand. This was by far the best green curry I've had anywhere in the US and rivaled many I've had in Thailand. It was deliciously creamy and perfectly spicy without being overpowering.  The mango with stick rice was great and portion size was very generous. The pad Thai was very good, but nothing more than usual pad Thai.  We got take out so my review is based on food quality alone. Also, the prices are extremely reasonable, $8-10 for an entree.

Absolutely horrible pad Thai! It literally tasted like they had opened up a can of Jiffy peanut butter and smeared it all on the noodles. I was highly disappointed, especially because the interior of this place looks so well put together! I was excited about this restaurant being in the neighborhood and possibly hosting parties there in the future. I won't be back.
Amazing flavors. Fresh ingredients. Tiger cry is so delicious and I will get it every time I dine here.

Always good, always fast, always correct.   You can't ask for anything more from a Thai restaurant.   And they focus solely on Thai, not wasting time trying to be everything to everyone who wants Asian cuisine.    I've had the curries, the Pad Thai, the fried rice, and a few of the Pad Prik spicy hot entrees.   I've never had a bad meal at this place, whether it's delivered (mostly) or sit down in the restaurant.   Also very affordable.   Five stars well earned.

Dining at Opart Thai House last night totally changed my perception of Thai food. Let me start by saying that I live in Hyde Park where there are quite a few Thai restaurants that I frequent often. Opart Thai stands above the rest before of the sheer freshness and unique flavors of its entrées. For appetizers, my friend and I dined on two orders of Tiger Cry (it's THAT good), Shu Mai, Spring Rolls and Cucumber Salad. The Tiger Cry is a dish of thinly sliced pieces of beef fried in an addictive sweet and spicy sauce. Don't dine there without trying it! For dinner, I had the Pad Thai with Shrimp. The noodles were fresh with a hint of sweetness, the cabbage was crisp and the shrimp was big and succulent. Dare I say it was the best I've had.  Now dessert absolutely blew my mind. My friend told me I had to try the Mango and Sticky Rice. I truly am glad I did. Maybe it's because I'm 9 months pregnant, but darn it, I do believe I am in love. Let me put it this way, my last meal on death row will have to include Tiger Cry, Pad Thai and Mango and Sticky Rice from Opart Thai!

Only been here once. Went with the waitstaff's recommendations. They recommended the Tiger Cry appetizer, which was fried beef, but about as good as fried beef gets. Very flavorful and tender. Everything else they recommended was pretty pedestrian and forgettable.  3 stars for the beef.

We had the beef appetizer dish (a14) on the menu. It was amazing.   I had the duck curry dish. Bland, bland, bland.  House Sangria was good. Rice was mushy. Really bad rice in an Asian restaurant. Unacceptable!
Ordered the e54 Khao Nar Ped.  With duck that was amazing.  The sampler was great as well.
I love their sweet and sour chicken, and they have the best jasmine tea I've ever had! Staff usually is kind of rushy, but generally pretty nice.

Some pretty delicious Thai food! My go to place this trip to Chicago for ASCO and 1000X better than McCormick conference food.  Although they are a little slow on getting food out if you order a ton, the food and flavors are delicious. Highly recommend and look forward to coming any time I'm at ASCO!
I absolutely LOVE this place. All I eat is the basil chicken with the sweet and sour sauce. I've also had the egg rolls which are quite tasty.

Food here is exquisite, truly. I take issue with a couple of things: a) it's lot and set up like a cafeteria (too brute and not charming in the least and b) there seem to be more cashiers than servers, which says a lot in my mind. Were they to engage more, this would be the best restaurant in South Loop but they simply aren't set-up for that.
chinatown's absolute best restaurant. period. tiger cry!!! [stand by for epic rotd or even rotw material]

The dinning environment is OK，the food here is boring-- we ordered Pad See You，Mango Sticky rice and Dom Yum Soup，none of them give a surprise. The taste is just like any other Thai fast food restaurant...... A little bit disappointed.

The papaya salad is fine, but no way as good as the one I ate on Thailand street. The curry fried rice is horribly salty, don't ever order this one. My friend ordered Pad Thai, and it's way too soft. The noodle is like broken...
Consistent great Thai food. Extremely affordable. Best spot in the neighborhood! Very clean and friendly service.

The food is fine. Not the issue. This is my first ever Yelp post. Purpose: to alert future customers. I placed an order for delivery using their integrated Chow Now service with a credit card I seldom use. The next day I received an alert from the CC company expressing concern over thousands of dollars suddenly in charges. Fraud and I knew precisely where it originated. Called Opart Thai- spoke with the manager who was sorry and reported no similar situations; I called Chow Now in California- same thing. DO NOT USE CREDIT CARDS or their CHOW NOW service. Pay in cash. I'll order again but for now I have a very bad taste in my mouth- pun intended. Thank you.

Slow service, tasteless food, not traditionally Thai!  As soon as my friend and I sat down, it took more than 10 minutes for a waitress to come and take our order. I ordered tofu satay thinking it would be similar to chicken satay, what I got were dry, unseasoned fried bits of tofu. The peanut sauce served alongside was very bland as well. We also ordered spring rolls, but again, those were seriously lacking in flavor and the wrapper was some of the thickest spring roll wrapping I've ever had. In an attempt to salvage the dinner, I sent the tofu satay back and ordered the chicken satay; still lacking in flavor and the texture of the chicken was kind of spongy. Took more than 15 minutes to get a check and pay. The Thai food in Chicago has been underwhelming to say the least, but this place was just horrible.

This place is ok. Nice ambience. Food is okay but nothing special. Service is polite. I wouldn't bring a date here or a client I wanted to impress. I would stop here for lunch if I were in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
This place is great. I have ordered for delivery a couple times now. The pad see-lew is great, and so is the Tiger Cry. All the apps are delicious. Also delivery is super quick!

So disappointing with all the great reviews. Im comparing the thai food from a popular thai place in vegas vs chicago thai food. First off service is super slow and lacking in customer service !! My waiter is more busy wiping down cups then servicing us and still charged 18% for doing practically nothing! She was not paying attention to us as we tried to flag her down serveral times and refilled our water cup once at the end of our meal. The portions are way smaller then what im used to in vegas and the flavor is lacking. The spice meter seems to be off as we order a pad thai spicy level 5 and tasted NO spiciness at all ! The eggplant dish was salty, the chicken panang portion was enough to feed a 5 yr old, and the only decent dish was their tiger cry. All in all super disappointed in this place with the slow customer service and mediocre food.

We used to eat from here weekly or bi-weekly for a period of two years. Something changed. I don't know what the change is but the quality of the food drastically changed. So sad that my old favorite has let me down. I hope you guys get it together.

Food is either overly sweetened or salted. This is definitely not a place for authentic Thai food. We ordered a bunch of food such as pad Thai and green curry, in the end we only enjoyed their fried rice.

Outstanding food and great service! The food was nice and light with amazing flavor. The waitress was extremely helpful at helping me decide what food to order since it was my first time eating at a Thai restaurant. I got a mild spice shrimp soup. Huge shrimps were in my bowl along with mushrooms. I ordered a side of rice which by the way tasted like coconut rice. I also had a main meal of broccoli and shrimp with peanut sauce. Delicious. I was trying to be good so I didn't eat everything but I could have since it was out of this world good. I recommend this place if you are in Chicago looking for food that leaves you wanting more.

I've been to this place twice, and I'm pleased every time. This time I tried the Gaeng Keow Waan w/ chicken, Pad Paak Roum Mit w/ chicken, and a Sample Platter appetizer. They give you a small bowl of rice with your entrée as well. The Pad Paak Roum Mit w/ chicken was a little Bland, just need a little soy sauce to make it better. With the Gaeng Keow Waan W/ chicken had a pleasent sweet distinctive taste. The Thai eggplant that comes with This dish might  feel weird in your mouth if your not a fan of it, but overall everything was a hit

Really Delish Thai food.  Found opart on Yelp and taxi driver confirmed we made a great choice. Then our tastebuds confirmed the same. Was with 3 work colleagues and we all enjoyed the food. The Tiger Cry very good.  Wine choices below average but service and atmosphere above average. On a Sunday afternoon quite crowded. Would definitely go back.

Unbelievable! They got the Thai spice levels just right! Amazing larb, papaya salad and Pad See Ew. The green curry with Thai eggplant and the beef Panang were delicately spiced and delicious! Don't forget to finish it off with mango sticky rice! Food coma!!!

I love spicy food. I'm not talking about Tabasco sauce-like spice, but rather mouth burning, nose running, eyes watering type spice. Everyone who truly loves Thai food knows that many Thai dishes are meant to be very spicy. Unfortunately, most restaurants need to dull down the spice to cater to the masses, but I asked for "Thai hot" and they made it perfectly spicy! Thank you for giving me an authentic Thai experience, Opart!

Every time I come here, I always get their duck curry.  So one time, I decided to try something else on their menu, and I didn't like it as much as the duck curry.  So I've came to accept to just stick with the things you like.  They have parking in the back, and you can enter the restaurant from the parking lot.

Totally decent thai but wasn't blown away. The cucumber salad wasn't very fresh tasting, the cucumbers were not very crisp. The spicy seafood soup was pretty good, definitely a very strong flavor of lime and the right amount of spice. It contained shrimp, imitation crab and octopus. The curries weren't quite what I was expecting. Panang is just chicken in sauce with no veggies at all and the chicken had a really weird consistency. Red curry was better with some veggies and a better flavored sauce but neither one was mind blowing. Reasonably priced but not really a strong reason to make a return visit.

Mediocre Thai at best. Also the Crab Rangoon was 80% cream cheese. I had the tiger cry which was just meat on lettuce but I put it over rice and it was decent, my bf had the pad Thai and it was very average and the beef was not that great. Don't think I'd eat it again.

I used to live 2 blocks away and would dine in and pick up from here almost weekly. During that time period I loved this place! Just ordered delivery from there tonight though and it was extremely disappointing. The pad see ewe we ordered spicy was not spicy at all. Not even a HINT of spice. The chicken larb we ordered medium and it was way too spicy. Not sure how they messed this up because we ordered online and input all the specifications. The icing on the cake was the side of sticky rice that was rock hard and inedible. It's a shame how much the quality has fallen. The only upside was the quick delivery, but I won't be eating from here again.

I think that their khol Soi is the best I have ever had. They make an amazing dish according to your spice level. Since it is very close to my house, I take out of order from there almost every week. I would totally recommend this place for a perfect, delicious and easy on the wallet Thai food .

Came here with a group of 14 on a Saturday on a whim and was impressed by their service. The staff seated us quickly and accommodated all our crazy requests. We probably had 7 separate checks and not everyone was sitting nicely in 2's and 4's, we were all over the place. The waitress was not only able to divide everything accurately on the checks, but also when they brought the food out. Another thing that Opart did very well was keeping up with water. They had pitchers of water on our tables but we never had to use them because their servers were on point. Our group was also a little drunk and loud so I appreciate Opart for their willingness to accommodate, I did not get to thank them in person. Also food was good.
5 stars. Special Kudos for the delicious Spicy Seafood Soup! Really good service and great atmosphere. Will come back again. Thank you!!!
Simple, easy and great food!  They also serve wine.  Kids love this place too.  Best Pad See Ew shrimp ever according to my son!  Tasty Chinese broccoli mixed in noodle dishes.

Customer service is amazing that is why I am giving two stars instead of 1. The food was not that good. I tried pad Thai and pad see ew. I am not a picky eater at all and I could not eat either. Best customer service ever though. I hope their dishes improve because it is a welcoming environment.
Had amazing dinner here and really nice staff as well. The price is not to bad for a entree about 8$ and everything tastes fresh and had a lot of flavor to it!
This place is great! The appetizers are the best and the food is very well priced!  You can literally spend $20-$30 on two people! No complaints what so ever! !! I highly recommend this place!
The best Thai place to eat a full,  heartly meal,  this side west of Bangkok.  Also,  by far the best place on the south loop.

When this place is banging, it's the bomb, but it can be inconsistent.  We typically get the Chicken Pad Thai, probably the best I've had in Chicago but sometimes it can be under-sauced and bland.  Pad See Ew and Curry Fried Rice are also good bets. Service is friendly and is great for takeout.

This is our go-to restaurant for everything. It's absolutely delicious, inexpensive and beautiful inside, so it's perfect for a random Wednesday dinner or for a night out with friends. We also had them cater our wedding - it's seriously that good.   My favorite entrees are their Pad Thai and their Pad Ma Moung Him Ma Pan (cashew beef or chicken). Definitely get a Thai iced tea when you go, and save room for the fried banana dessert!

We've been coming for about 8 years.  The meals are always great but tonight was exceptional!  We had crispy Crab Rangoon, terrific Tiger Cry, spicy Beef Salad, Chicken Tom Yum soup medium that was just hot enough for us,  great Shrimp Fried rice, wonderful Chicken Pad Thai, and tender Beef with Chinese Broccoli.  Everything was seasoned differently and tasted great! My sisters and I are fairly good cooks but the chefs here are out of our league.  The waiter was very attentive as well as the young man pouring water. Thank you for a wonderful meal!
absolutely delicious! i loved all the food!  im from new york so this was extremely comforting :)

I have been a regular of this place for a number of years but it has really started to go downhill fast.  The staff are rude and the service has  become extremely inconsistent.  I just called to complain about a carry out order and the attitude is "oh well".  If that's the case I won't be back and I wouldn't recommend.

The other two Thai places I always went to around the Sloop closed down (Ma & I and Sala Bua), so we had to resort to this.  A lot of people I know have been hyping it up for a while, so we wanted to give it a shot.  Did not let us down one bit, and it's definitely better than the other two places were. We got some soup, pad see ew (sp?), and the infamous Tiger Cry appetizer.  Tiger Cry is legit and a must get!!  Perfectly cooked and flavored cube cut pieces of beef.  Kind of similar to the French Cut Style Beef Tenderloin from Go4Food.

Done pick up (I live in west loop and miss the delivery radius by two blocks but the new Chicago Ave location delivers to us!) and dined in. Came in on a Friday around 6:30pm. Packed but got seated fast. They have a full bar and work quick. We split the giant wonton soup between two and then got Penang and green curries with chicken. It was yummy! Planning to pick up tonight but definitely going to try delivery from the new location next time I'm craving it!

Very authentic Thai food! My new favorite restaurant in Chicago. Some really good specialties include tom yum (soup), nam tok (beef) and pad siew.  The ambience is spacious and servers are very nice and considerate.

Went on a Friday night with 3 others. Plenty of tables available to choose from.  Staff was friendly.  Curry was pretty good, and they took spice level preferences seriously.  The Riesling on the menu was delicious.
Have had good pad Thai here before, but last night's take out order brought with it a case of horrible food poisoning. WASH YOUR HANDS AFTER TOUCHING YOUR ASS!!

2nd time here, I try to not review on the 1st visit~ Came in a bigger group so I got to try more. Curry fried rice was awesome and their Tom Yum soup was great (nice & spicy). The tiger cry is yummy as well, other reviewers are correct in that being their top dish. I was recommended by a co-worker to try their peanut lover, it was good but not for me. Too sweet I think, and I requested spicy and it wasnt. That made me sad. Overall still good thou. I would go back, but not my go to thou.

My husband and I have been eating at Opart Thai since we were college students (about 8 years ago). We still can't stay away. The food is superb. The Tiger Cry has unbelievably juicy and tasty pieces of beef - do yourself a favor and try it.  The Tom Yum soup is superb. The perfect heat and taste. My only problem is, I can't afford this place regularly!

I used to LOVE this place until I found out that they use MSG! It's widely known that MSG causes a whole slew of health problems including strokes.  It's unfortunate that restaurants rely on MSG instead of using fresh ingredients and good spices to make their food taste good.

Opart Thai never disappoints! Whether you're looking for classic Pad Thai or something more adventurous, you won't be disappointed.  We've dined in and we regularly get delivery. I even recently had them cater lunch for 60+ at my office and it was excellent, on-time, and plentiful for the cost of a hot catered lunch. Highly recommended!

Did not like the dumpling appetizer (basically just fried, very thick bread around a ball of questionable pork - don't order these unless you want state-fair style breaded pork) or the noodle dish that I got. There is no other way to sum this place up except that it just isn't good. I won't be ordering from here again.

Delivery was fast!  I ordered online and the food was to our door within 30 mins. Pad thai was good. Flavors were there and shrimp was fresh. Masaman curry was also good.  Curry flavor was mild and creamy.  Chicken was tender.  We got it with brown rice which was cooked perfectly. Papaya salad was boring - the papaya itself was a bit tough, seasoning was also not exciting.  I'm typically a huge fan of papaya salads, this one just didn't do much for me.   Pad Kra Praow Pla - the sautéed sole fish was REALLY spicy.  I like heat so it didn't bother me too much but I definitely welcomed the curry breaks in between bites.  I was really disappointed the fish was actually deep fried even though the menu indicated it's sautéed.  All in all the food did not disappoint but it did not really wow us either.  The portions are small for the price.  Thai delivery is really a dime a dozen and I'm not convinced this will be our go-to place.

This is my go to spot for chicken pad thai in Chicago. Food always tastes delicious, and it's not your typical orange colored pad thai. Yes, it may taste different but it's delicious. Would also recommend the bami moo daeng in the soup. Have been ordering from here for quite a while now and it never gets old! Delivery is outlandishly quick and it never takes more than an hour.
great pad thai! overall,  I'll eat again.
Fantastic Food! Period. Nice ambience and convenient location with Park Chicago Curbside Parking right in front!

I had heard amazing things about this restaurant and so was excited to try it. The delivery came quickly and was hot, but honestly the food was really nothing special. The red curry was not flavorful, and the peanut sauce with chicken was watery and flavorless. Both dishes had such thin and watery sauces. I was pretty disappointed. I'll stick to Sala Bua for my Thai fix from here on out!

Went here about a week or two ago with my wife. We ordered a spring roll appetizer and an order of shrimp pad see ew. When we went to pickup and got home, the spring rolls were actually tofu satay. We called the restaurant back and they said they will make another order of spring rolls for us. Since we only live a block away, it was convenient to go pick it up. The pad see ew was good, nothing really set it apart from others we've had, but given how convenient it is for us and how much my wife likes Thai food, we'll be back

After reading all the remarkable reviews I decided to try out this place with my mother one late afternoon  (about a month ago). The service was horrible, no communication for our waitress at all. She handed us or menus and came back a couple of mins later she stood in front of our table and said nothing, I guess we were supposed to use nonverbal communication. We gave her our orders and she left the table, she didn't ask if we wanted drinks or anything. Fast forward, when we were halfway finished with our meals she gave us the check, and I proceeded to ask her if I could  have extra rice to go, she told me that she would go to the back and ask. Long story short, she never came back or said anything about my request. During our visit, we never received a 'welcome' or a 'thank you for coming'. And the food wasn't memorable at all... Maybe I came on the wrong day or at the wrong time.

If I am in the mood for Thai in Chicago, there is no choice but to head to Opart Thai House. The food is consistently delicious and fresh. The Tiger Cry is not to be missed! I also really enjoy the Spicy Fried Tofu. The curries are numerous and all delicious! This is authentic Thai in a relaxed, cool atmosphere.

We have delivery from this place. Our order consisted of seafood fried rice, chicken pad Thai, tiger cry, wonton and egg drop soup and shrimp sticks. Overall I thought the food was fresh and well prepared. The tiger cry seemed to be what most enjoyed. However I had the seafood fried rice and it was good yet once I had a bit of soy sauce it was much better. I would get food from them if I'm ever in the mood for takeout.

This is my go-to place for thai delivery. My favorite dishes include pad thai, shrimp fried rice, pad prik king, and fried tofu. I usually add tofu and extra veggies to the pad thai and rice. My meat-eating boyfriend also loves the tiger cry appetizer.
Place is definitely overrated. The food is ok, but not for the price. Egg roles are terrible.

Been getting delivery from here for the past couple of years and it has always been great.  The tiger cry is the best thing I've ever tried here. Delicious meat with an addicting sauce  Tom yom goong is delicious. Perfectly sour with lots of mushrooms, yum!  The gaeng daeng curry is REALLY good. So delicious, only complaint is the small portion  I've tried both pad Thai and pad see yeu and both Ive been indifferent about. Need to step up the noodle game  Overall one of my fave Thai places to order from but usually stick to the curry and tiger cry.

If you live in the South Loop neighborhood and haven't given this restaurant a chance, get yourself right in there.  They had this interesting fountain artwork on their bar counter, when I asked what it was I was told it was feng shuy and that it had brought their business luck.  Love that!  I had the spicy veggie curry, opted for medium heat, which was right on.  If you are looking for intimate, quiet restaurant, this is not it but comfortable enough environment for group discussions over a good meal.

I generally get my entrees vegetable only.  The tofu is completely unnecessary.  The pork has always proven enjoyable, but their chicken has always been disappointing.  The pieces are too large to really take on the flavor of the dish before cooked.  You ultimately end up with a lot of gamey, tough chunks of chicken that you're not going to eat.
First Timer .  Ordered Fried Wontons, Chicken Satay, and Basil Chicken for pickup. Everything was really good. I will definitely order from here again
Great thai place to eat if you're ever in town. My friend took me here and I love their pad thai noodle. To top it off I had their authentic thai ice tea. Will definitely stop by again!

The food here is consistently delicious. I particularly love the Thai Custard, yum.The different types of curries and variety in menu is very welcoming. I visit this friendly restaurant regularly, the young waiters are very courteous and friendly.  The restaurant decor is very appealing with plenty of ornaments to keep you busy looking and wondering. Over the years sadly the portions keep getting smaller for which I removed a star.

Disappointed at this Thai establishment! Thai food being one of my top go to food and since I have been craving for some good thai food every since I moved to Chicago - I thought to give this a try since they had such high rating. Totally disappointed :(. So first to mention the good things - they have a free parking lot at the back of the store which is great for some one who sucks at parallel parking. They will substitute tofu as protein for any of their dishes. The soup tom yum broth was really flavorful and tat is where the good things end. They don't have soft tofu and they use this tofu which they semi fry but the texture is really tough and taste like old tofu which has been sitting around for long. The basil fried rice was not spicy nor tasted or smelt of basil. The Pad Ped (Normally my fav Thai Curry) had no gravy/sauce and the veges were still left raw so they had no flavor. The fresh roll does not taste or look like a fresh roll - it is a semi fried veg roll with tofu and sauce poured over it. The tofu satay with peanut sauce and cucumber salad tastes weird - again I think becoz of the tofu they use...Over all still looking for a good Thai Place...any recommendations?

AVOID this place at all costs!!!! They are horrible to deal with! Twice on their website we have ordered delivery, after some time of not receiving our order, we have called them to discover the order came through as pick up. The first time we thought it was our fault, the second time we knew it was not our fault... Call them and someone will treat you like shit telling you that they are right and you are wrong... Ask to speak to a manager and she will not be there for several days. Good food but HORRIBLE service!!!

So very disappointing. I live down the street, we used to eat here occasionally. I thought it was meh with a few ok go-to dishes. Now its just gross. Ordered some hard-to ruin dishes tonight, including their 'specialty' the tiger cry. everything was bland, little flavor, no heat, and the tempura was bad on a few levels. Sadly, not going back. Another neighborhood joint takes a dive. Boo.

I ordered from here off of GrubHub and delivery was absurdly quick.  The food was made and delivered to my door within 30 minutes of my putting the order in online - and I lived just blocks away from Grant Park where Lollapalooza was still going on mind you. I had the crab rangoon, the moo ping, and a side of sticky rice.  All of them were on par with to slightly better than what I've had at other Thai restaurants.
This is my go-to Thai restaurant in Chicago. Good quality food all-around. It's hard for me to find a reason to travel farther for Thai food when Opart Thai is 2 blocks from my apartment.
The best green curry! Addictive my spivey and flavorful! Great place go for dinner close to the convention center. Walkable!

I wish I could give the restaurant five stars. This is was my second time at this location and thought .... The food is delicious. Disclosure- I'm vegetarian and am strictly speaking of their tofu dishes.... Both times I've been here the food has been fast and for the most part really good. However on both occasions my server seems disengaged. I had no water the majority of my stay. My server got half of my order before she was leaving. And in both occasions I had to go up to the counter and ask for sauces because my server never asked if I wanted them and was no where to be found. I understand if the restaurant is busy, I was a server myself. But when I can see you by the Courbet talking to your coworkers and your tables have not been attended, that's a red flag. I don't want my waiter to hound me but things like not running off and making sure your clients have water are basic necessities that every restaurant needs. I don't know maybe next time I'll order delivery and update this. The stars are only because of the food! The food rocked!!

I've never eaten in, but this is the go-to delivery/carry out for Thai in the South Loop. They always have the food ready quickly, and it's always amazing. The red chicken curry and crab rangoons always satisfy my craving, and the dishes are big enough to split.

Look no further, hands down best Thai food in Chicago!  From the Pad Thai to their Curry dishes, this place is great! The owners are so friendly, it is a family business, and they use the best ingredient for their dishes. And you can tell. When dishes like the Tiger Cry (which you must try) come from their mom's recipe you know it's legit.  All in all, this place is a usual in our restaurant rotation. You must now go and try it also. Let me know what you thought!
